title: Multiplying the Numerator and Denominator
text: We can multiply the numerator and denominators to get $$\frac{\left(16-4x\right) \left(x^2-4x-6\right)}{\left(2x-12\right) \left(x^2-16\right)}$$

title: Simplifying if Necessary
text: This fraction can be simplified through factoring. $$\frac{\left(16-4x\right) \left(x^2-5x-6\right)}{\left(2x-12\right) \left(x^2-16\right)}=\frac{\left(16-4x\right) \left(x-6\right) \left(x+1\right)}{\left(2x-12\right) \left(x+4\right) \left(x-4\right)}=\frac{-2\left(x+1\right)}{x+4}$$
